00021 /**
00022  * @file   apt-dmet-translation.cpp
00023  * @author Mybrid Spalding
00024  * @date   Wed Jun  4 08:29:07 PDT 2008
00025  * @brief  Commandline controller wrapper around TranslateEngine.run().
00026  */
00027 
00028 //
00029 #include "translation/TranslationEngine.h"
00030 //
00031 #include "util/AptVersionInfo.h"
00032 #include "util/Err.h"
00033 #include "util/Fs.h"
00034 #include "util/Guid.h"
00035 #include "util/LogStream.h"
00036 #include "util/Util.h"
00037 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00038 
00039 using namespace std;
00040 
00041 
00042 /*****************************************************************************/
00043 /**
00044  * translateEngineMessageHandlingCallBack
00045  * Synopsis:
00046  *
00047  *  There is a catch 22 where the command line message handlers need to
00048  * have the PGOptions information in order to set up the message handling
00049  * log file name, etc. Resolve this by passing in a call back to the
00050  * TranslateEngine constructor which initializes the PGOptions.
00051  *
00052  * @param atdOopts - filled in with all the PGOptions data.
00053  *
00054  * @return - nada, initializes message handling.
00055  */
00056 /*****************************************************************************/
00057 void translateEngineMessageHandlingCallBack(ADTOptions & adtOpts)
00058 {
00059 
00060   Err::setThrowStatus(true);
00061 
00062   std::string verboseLogName;
00063 
00064   if (adtOpts.m_logFile != "") {
00065     verboseLogName = adtOpts.m_logFile;
00066   }
00067   else {
00068     verboseLogName = Fs::join(adtOpts.m_outputDir,"apt-dmet-translation.log");
00069   }
00070 
00071   std::ofstream *verboseOFStream = new std::ofstream;
00072 
00073   if (!Fs::isWriteableDir(adtOpts.m_outputDir)) {
00074     if (Fs::mkdirPath(adtOpts.m_outputDir, false) != APT_OK) {
00075       APT_ERR_ABORT("Can't make or write to directory: " + adtOpts.m_outputDir);
00076     }
00077   }
00078   Fs::mustOpenToWrite(*(verboseOFStream), verboseLogName.c_str());
00079 
00080   ADT_VERBOSE_ENUM logVerbosity = ADT_VERBOSE_EXCEPTION;
00081   if (adtOpts.m_verbosity > ADT_VERBOSE_EXCEPTION) {
00082     logVerbosity = (ADT_VERBOSE_ENUM) adtOpts.m_verbosity;
00083   }
00084 
00085   LogStream *verboseLogStream = new LogStream(logVerbosity,  verboseOFStream, false);
00086 
00087   Verbose::pushMsgHandler(verboseLogStream);
00088   Verbose::pushProgressHandler(verboseLogStream);
00089   Verbose::pushWarnHandler(verboseLogStream);
00090   Verbose::setLevel(adtOpts.m_verbosity);
00091 
00092   return;
00093 }
00094 // end translateEngineMessageHandlingCallBack
00095 /*****************************************************************************/
00096 /*****************************************************************************/
00097 /**
00098  * apt-dmet-translation main
00099  *
00100  * @param argc -
00101  * @param argv -
00102  * @return - exit 0 when ok.
00103  */
00104 /*****************************************************************************/
00105 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00106 {
00107   try {
00108     const string version = AptVersionInfo::version();
00109     const string cvsId = AptVersionInfo::cvsId();
00110     const string versionToReport = AptVersionInfo::versionToReport();
00111     const string execGuid = affxutil::Guid::GenerateNewGuid();
00112 
00113     /// @todo This isnt how an engine should be invoked or have options set.
00114     ///       Attemping to process the "--help" option causes BaseEngine to print:
00115     ///          "running TranslationEngine" before it prints the help message.
00116     TranslationEngine engine(argv, C_CMDLINE, &translateEngineMessageHandlingCallBack);
00117     engine.setOpt("command-line",engine.commandLine());
00118     engine.setOpt("program-name","apt-dmet-translation");
00119     engine.setOpt("program-company","Affymetrix");
00120     engine.setOpt("program-version",version);
00121     engine.setOpt("program-cvs-id",cvsId);
00122     engine.setOpt("version-to-report",versionToReport);
00123     engine.setOpt("exec-guid",execGuid);
00124     if(argc == 1) { engine.setOpt("help","true"); }
00125     engine.run();
00126     exit(0);
00127   } 
00128   catch(...) {
00129       Verbose::out(1,"Unexpected Error: uncaught exception.");
00130       return 1;
00131   }
00132   return 1;
00133 }
00134 // end main
